trans-unit.target:
TEXT_BANYOK114_05349_SEQ_00<tab>Vuyargur would see the workers take their scheduled break.
※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level. Furthermore, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.

TEXT_BANYOK114_05349_TODO_00<tab>With the chat mode in <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Say<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, enter “The chairo is ready” to encourage the Yok Huy in the Shades of Grief to take a break.
TEXT_BANYOK114_05349_TODO_01<tab>Speak with Vuyargur.

TEXT_BANYOK114_05349_VUYARGUR_000_000<tab>Late again... <sigh> Oh, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. Some workers gathering materials in the Shades of Grief have yet to return for their break. I have impressed upon them the importance of regularly scheduled rest for overall productivity, and yet!

TEXT_BANYOK114_05349_VUYARGUR_000_001<tab>As an added incentive, I have prepared a fresh batch of chairo, a warming stew much loved in these parts. I suspect a hot meal will make them forget their tasks for a few brief moments.
TEXT_BANYOK114_05349_VUYARGUR_000_002<tab>Could I trouble you to visit the Shades of Grief and inform them that the chairo is ready?
TEXT_BANYOK114_05349_SAYTODO_000_010<tab>The chairo is ready
TEXT_BANYOK114_05349_YOKHUYWORKERA05349_000_020<tab>Must...get...more stone...!

TEXT_BANYOK114_05349_SYSTEM_000_021<tab>With the chat mode in <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Say<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, use your keyboard or the software keyboard to enter “The chairo is ready” to grab the Yok Huy's attention.
TEXT_BANYOK114_05349_YOKHUYWORKERA05349_000_022<tab>Did someone say chairo?
TEXT_BANYOK114_05349_YOKHUYWORKERA05349_000_023<tab>My favorite! We Yok Huy can't get enough of the stuff. If you cut me open, I daresay I'd bleed chairo!
TEXT_BANYOK114_05349_YOKHUYWORKERA05349_000_024<tab>I must return while the pot is warm. My thanks, friend!
TEXT_BANYOK114_05349_YOKHUYWORKERB05349_000_030<tab>Ow-ow-ow, my back...! Still, I must press on...!
TEXT_BANYOK114_05349_YOKHUYWORKERB05349_000_031<tab>Uwah! I near jumped out of my skin...
TEXT_BANYOK114_05349_YOKHUYWORKERB05349_000_032<tab>I-I mean...ahem. Apologies, I did not notice you approach. Did I hear you mention chairo?
TEXT_BANYOK114_05349_YOKHUYWORKERB05349_000_033<tab>Why, it is long past time for my break! And I shall feel all the more rested after a hot meal.

TEXT_BANYOK114_05349_YOKHUYWORKERB05349_000_034<tab>With Nopli providing us with so many different ingredients and spices as of late, people have been experimenting with new chairo recipes. I wonder what's stewing today!
TEXT_BANYOK114_05349_VUYARGUR_000_040<tab>My thanks for passing along the message. Both workers returned safe and sound and are presently enjoying a well-earned repast.

TEXT_BANYOK114_05349_VUYARGUR_000_041<tab>The restoration is arduous work, to be sure, and they are wont to overexert themselves. Though my chairo started as a simple way to encourage more regular breaks, I must say it has turned into quite the culinary adventure...

TEXT_BANYOK114_05349_VUYARGUR_000_042<tab>Of late, I have been experimenting with different meats and spices to create the most rejuvenating meal possible. Several have proved quite a hit with the workers—at this rate, I'll be opening my own eatery!

TEXT_BANYOK114_05349_VUYARGUR_000_043<tab>Even so, I suspect our workers may continue to neglect their breaks without someone to remind them. I hope I may count on your help in rounding them up again!
